alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 20 at 10:48AM CDT until March 27 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Dakota... Maple River near Enderlin affecting Ransom and Cass Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Maple River near Mapleton (South of I-94) affecting Cass County. Sheyenne River near Kindred affecting Richland and Cass Counties. .Rivers have been rising due to runoff from snow melt. Forecast river stages include observed precipitation as well as forecasted precipitation for the next 48 hours. For the Sheyenne River...including Valley City, Lisbon, Kindred, West Fargo, Harwood...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Maple River...including Enderlin, Mapleton (South of I-94)... Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maple River near Mapleton (South of I-94). * WHEN...Until Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM CDT Sunday was 18.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.9 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
